intro: Strongylocalyx lanceifolius, commonly known as the lanceleaf strongylocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
